Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. The movie centers around when he had just left Waseda University at the age of only nineteen years old. That period was filled with poignant disillusionment from realities exposed by reality, which was something rarely experienced by males his age in that days.

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat.
